write_line.name: Write a line to the console

write_line_with_new_line.name: Write a line to the console with a return character

read_line.name: Read a line of user input from the console
read_line.comment: The `readline` module is a part of the Node.js standard library. It is not available in the browser.

read_char.name: Read a single char of user input from the console
read_char.comment: The character can be read by accessing the first character of readline.question's answer.

change_console_background_color.name: Change the color of the console
change_console_background_color.comment: Console background color cannot be changed but CSS properties can be applied to the console output.

change_console_text_color.name: Change the color of the console
change_console_text_color.comment: Console text color cannot be changed but CSS properties can be applied to the console output.

file_functions_lib.name: Library containing file IO functions
file_functions_lib.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

list_directory.name: List of the items in the current directory
list_directory.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

read_directory_info.name: Get infomation about the current directory (number of items, size, etc)
read_directory_info.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

create_directory.name: Create a directory
create_directory.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

delete_directory.name: Delete a directory
delete_directory.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

rename_directory.name: Rename a directory
rename_directory.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

move_directory.name: Move a directory to another locaiton
move_directory.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

update_directory_permissions.name: Update the permissions a user, group, or application has to a directory
update_directory_permissions.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

read_line_of_file.name: Read a single line from a file
read_line_of_file.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

read_lines_of_file.name: Read all the lines in a file
read_lines_of_file.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

read_file_stream.name: Read the file into a stream
read_file_stream.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

create_file.name: Create a file
create_file.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

delete_file.name: Delete a file
delete_file.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

update_file.name: Update a file
update_file.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

move_file.name: Move a file to a new location
move_file.comment: The `fs` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

send_a_http_request.name: Send a HTTP request
send_a_http_request.comment: `method` should be the HTTP method (GET, POST, etc). `url` should be the URL of the request (as string).

add_headers.name: Add headers to a HTTP request

add_query_params.name: Add query parameters to a HTTP request

open_a_socket.name: Open a network socket
open_a_socket.comment: The `net` module is a part of Node.js and is not available in the browser.

add_cookies.name: Add cookies to a HTTP request

read_cookies.name: Read cookies from a HTTP response

read_headers.name: Read headers from a HTTP response
read_headers.comment: `header_name` should be the name of the header property (as string) like `Content-Type`.

execute_query_single_result_set.name: Execute a query returning a single result set

execute_query_multiple_result_sets.name: Execute a query returning a multiple result sets

serialize_json_with_options.name: Serialize an object to JSON with options
serialize_json_with_options.comment: The `replacer` and `space` parameters are optional. The `replacer` parameter can be a function or an array of properties to include. The `space` parameter can be a number or a string.

deserialize_json_with_options.name: Deserialize a string from JSON with options
deserialize_json_with_options.comment: The `reviver` parameter (the last parameter) is optional and is a function that can be used to transform the deserialized object.

serialize_xml_with_options.name: Serialize an object to XML with options

deserialize_xml_with_options.name: Deserialize a string from XML with options

read_csv_file.name: Reading a CSV file
read_csv_file.comment: CSV files are text files and can be read using the `fs` module.

read_csv_to_type.name: Reading a CSV file to a typed array
read_csv_to_type.comment: CSV files are text files and can be read using the `fs` module. The output can be parsed to a typed array.

write_csv_file.name: Write a new CSV file
write_csv_file.comment: CSV files are text files and can be written using the `fs` module.

append_csv_file.name: Append to end of CSV file
append_csv_file.comment: CSV files are text files and can be written using the `fs` module.

set_csv_delimiter.name: Set the CSV delitmiter to use when reading/writing
set_csv_delimiter.comment: CSV files are text files and can be read/written using the `fs` module.
